name: Reddit Beta Clean Rework
description: Ive fixed a few inconsistencies. The reddit beta ui is one of the most horrible UIs ive seen out here. I thought I'd just improve it myself and use that instead complaining. Better color/size/weight hierarchy. Generally a better and well looking design
additional_info:
Less is more. Heres a list of the changes about things that bothered me the most.

Posts

The title wasnt blue. Instead, the links were. This added a lot clutter.
The url is alot shorter now.
Removed "Posted" and left only "by". Having "Posted" repeating is unnecessary.
Removed serval icons. Repetition adds cluttering.
Changed the icons of the extenders below the post.
The extend button with Save Hide & Report is now an arrow down. Instead of 3 points.
In my opinion reddit is shooing itself in the foot with hiding "Give Gold" behind a further button.

Sidebar

Is now opened up by default
It is a lot more space-saving now
OPENING A POST

When youre opening a post its not popping up with a black-transparent background anymore. Instead = it fills up the space where the post-list itself is. This is an important step in continuity.

It is loading a lot faster than the old reddit in comparison.

discussions.name: Voting buttons doesn't work (Lighten when pressed)
Left side bar doesn't hide when toggled
